poem:
### School WhatsApp Group

In the half-light of my phone screen,  
the chatter quilts my morning,  
a village of emojis and exclamation    
where permission slips flutter  
and tirades burrow like moles.  
A silent chorus, mimed by thumbs,  
each message a pebble,   
plinking into an ever-rippling pond  
of parenthood's busy, buzzing hive.
